items.item_details:
EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICT
	 
Item:  6.01
	 
	 
TO:
Board of Trustees
				 
				 
FROM:
Chris D. Funk, Superintendent
				 
				 
PREPARED BY:
Cari Vaeth, Director, Human Resources
				 
				 
SUBJECT:
Discussion and/or Action to Rescind/Revoke Certificated Personnel Action/Consent Item 19.02, Presented October 17, 2013, Purporting to Grant Permanent Status as it Pertains to One Current Certificated Employee
	 
	 
	 
Pursuant to Education Code section 44929.21, a certificated employee who is employed by the District for two complete consecutive school years in a position requiring certification qualifications, and who is reelected for the next succeeding school year to a position requiring certification qualifications shall, at the commencement of the succeeding school year be classified as and become a permanent employee of the District.
	 
At a regular meeting of the Governing Board held on October 17, 2013, the Board took action under Consent/Action Item 19.02 to grant permanent employment status to those certificated employees who met the criteria for attaining permanent status under Education Code section 44929.21.  Due to a clerical error, certificated employee Robert Goldstein, who at that time had completed only one year of certificated employment with the District and who was, therefore, ineligible to attain permanent status, was inadvertently included among the list of those employees recommended for permanent status.  As a result, the Agenda memo for Item 19.02 inadvertently included and identified Robert Goldstein as among the District certificated employees eligible to receive, and receiving, permanent employment status pursuant to section 44929.21.
	 
The Board is requested to rescind its action taken on Consent/Action Item 19.02, on October 17, 2013, solely as it pertains to certificated employee Robert Goldstein, thereby clarifying Robert Goldstein’s continued and continuous Probationary 2 status.
	 
FUNDING SOURCE:
General
	 
FISCAL IMPACT:
None
	 
RECOMMENDATION:
It is recommended that the Board of Trustees rescind and revoke its action taken on Consent/Action Item 19.02, on October 17, 2013, solely as it pertains to certificated employee Robert Goldstein, thereby clarifying Robert Goldstein’s continued and continuous Probationary 2 status.

items.item_details:
Members of the public may address the Board on any subject not on tonight’s agenda; however, provisions of the Brown Act (Government Code Section 54954.2(a) and 54954.3) preclude any action.  As an unagendized item, no response is required from the Board or District staff and no action can be taken; however, the Board may instruct the Superintendent to agendize the item for a future meeting.  When your name is called, please come to the podium, state your name for the record, and limit your remarks to three (3) minutes.
	 
Any person may address the Board on any item on the meeting agenda.  Persons wishing to address the Board must fill out a gold request form, which is located at the entrance of the Board Room.
